briefdescription.para: module ABI version the kernel expects

simplesect.para: If we change the ABI at all, we must bump this by 1. It is used in the names of the init/exit functions of each module, so an incompatible module is outright rejected before it can wreak havoc in the kernel space.

briefdescription.para: Set this prefix on all module_init/module_exit functions in modules.
helpers to form symbol names
canonical names as strings
Load and relocate a module from an in-memory ELF64 ET_REL buffer, then call its initialiser.

detaileddescription.para: Validates the ELF header, allocates a single contiguous region for all SHF_ALLOC sections, copies/zeros contents with correct alignment, applies all SHT_RELA relocations, resolves undefined globals against the kernel dynamic symbol table (from kernel.sym), resolves versioned mod_init/mod_exit, then calls mod_init

parameterdescription.para: size of the ELF buffer in bytes
output descriptor populated on success; zeroed on entry

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error
the input buffer is not retained and may be freed after return
fails if any relocation overflows or an undefined symbol cannot be resolved

briefdescription.para: Unload a module by calling its finaliser and freeing its memory.

detaileddescription.para: Calls mod_exit if present, frees the contiguous allocation, and clears the descriptor

parameterdescription.para: module descriptor previously returned by module_load_from_memory

simplesect.para: true on success, false if m is NULL or teardown fails

briefdescription.para: Resolve a kernel global by name via the kernel dynamic symbol table.

detaileddescription.para: Requires the kernel to be linked with export-dynamic and to KEEP .dynsym and .dynstr

simplesect.para: symbol address on success, NULL if not found

briefdescription.para: Resolve a symbol by name within a loaded module after relocation.

detaileddescription.para: Looks up the symbol in the modules own SHT_SYMTAB/STRTAB and computes its run-time address

simplesect.para: address within the module image, or NULL if not found or undefined

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *file, size_t len, const elf_ehdr **eh, const elf_shdr **sh, size_t *shnum, const char **shstr)
memberdef.name: parse_elf_rel_headers

briefdescription.para: Parse and validate the ELF64 ET_REL header and section table.

detaileddescription.para: Performs basic structural checks and returns pointers into the provided buffer

parameterdescription.para: size of the buffer in bytes
out: pointer to the ELF header inside file
out: pointer to the section header table inside file
out: pointer to the section-name string table inside file

simplesect.para: true if the buffer looks like a valid ELF64 ET_REL object, else false

briefdescription.para: Predicate for sections that must be placed in memory at load time.

simplesect.para: true if SHF_ALLOC is set, else false

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *file, const elf_shdr *sh, size_t shnum, module *m)
memberdef.name: module_place_sections

briefdescription.para: Allocate one contiguous block and place all SHF_ALLOC sections into it.

detaileddescription.para: Computes total size with per-section alignment, allocates with kmalloc_aligned, copies SHT_PROGBITS contents, zeros SHT_NOBITS, and records the run-time base of each placed section

parameterdescription.para: module descriptor to populate (base, size, placed[], placed_count)

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error

briefdescription.para: Return the run-time base address for a placed section.

simplesect.para: base address where that section was placed, or NULL if unknown

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *file, const elf_shdr *sh, size_t shnum, module *m)
memberdef.name: module_load_symbols

briefdescription.para: Locate the modules static symbol table and its associated string table.

simplesect.para: true on success, false if tables are missing

briefdescription.para: Index into the module symbol table.

simplesect.para: pointer to the symbol, or NULL if out of range

briefdescription.para: Compute a symbols absolute run-time address post-relocation.

detaileddescription.para: For SHN_UNDEF symbols resolves against the kernel via kernel_dlsym For defined symbols returns placed_section_base + st_value

simplesect.para: absolute address on success, 0 on failure

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *file, const elf_shdr *sh, size_t shnum, module *m)
memberdef.name: module_apply_relocations

briefdescription.para: Apply all SHT_RELA relocations for the module.

detaileddescription.para: Supports R_X86_64_64, R_X86_64_PC32, R_X86_64_32 and R_X86_64_32S Undefined globals are resolved via kernel_dlsym; overflows cause failure

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error
R_X86_64_PC32 must only target intra-module references externals should appear as R_X86_64_64 when modules are built with -mcmodel=large -fno-pic -fno-plt

briefdescription.para: Initialise the module registry and loader state.

detaileddescription.para: Creates the in-kernel hashmap used to track loaded modules keyed by name Must be called once before any other module operations

briefdescription.para: Load and start a module by name.

detaileddescription.para: Constructs the path /system/modules/<name>.ko, reads the file, relocates it, resolves externals against the kernel symbol index, and calls mod_init Returns false if the module is already loaded or on any failure

parameterdescription.para: NUL-terminated module base name without extension or path

simplesect.para: true on success, false on error

briefdescription.para: Stop and unload a loaded module by name.

detaileddescription.para: Locates the module in the registry, calls mod_exit if present, frees all allocations associated with the image, and removes the entry from the registry

simplesect.para: true on success, false if not found or unload failed

briefdescription.para: Minimal ELF64 definitions and the run-time module loader interface.

detaileddescription.para:
Provides:
A compact, libc-free subset of ELF64 constants and structs used by the loader
The module descriptor describing a loaded, relocated module image
The public API for loading, relocating, resolving, and unloading modules

simplesect.para: These definitions intentionally avoid pulling in <elf.h> to keep the kernel freestanding. Layout matches the System V ABI for ELF64
